fields¶

Field objects transform python objects into objects which can be stored as a value in a MongoDB document. They control the conversions and validation of the data.

If you want to define your own type of Field there are four methods a subclass must implement:

  • Field.wrap() — Takes a value and returns an object composed entirely of types that MongoDB understands (dicts, lists, numbers, strings, datetimes, etc.)

  • Field.unwrap() — Takes a value in the format produced by wrap() and

    returns a python object.

wrap() and unwrap() should be inverse operations. In particular, field.unwrap(field.wrap(obj)) == obj should always be true.

  • Field.validate_wrap() — Raises a BadValueException if calling wrap() will fail. This function should be fast, as it will be called whenever a value

    is set on a document for this type of field.

  • Field.validate_unwrap() — Raises a BadValueException if calling unwrap() will fail.

To just check whether something is valid for wrapping or unwrapping, each field has a Field.is_valid_wrap() and an Field.is_valid_unwrap() function which call their respective validation function, returning True if a BadValueException is not raised.

The documentation for each Field class will largely just be giving the input and output types for wrap() and unwrap().

Field Objects¶

class mongoalchemy.fields.Field(required=True, default=UNSET, db_field=None)¶

Field class docs

db_field¶

The name to use when setting this field on a document. If db_field is passed to the constructor, that is returned. Otherwise the value is the name which this field was assigned to on the owning document.

wrap(value)¶

Returns an object suitable for setting as a value on a MongoDB object. Raises NotImplementedError in the base class.

Parameters:
  • value: The value to convert.
unwrap(value)¶

Returns an object suitable for setting as a value on a subclass of Document. Raises NotImplementedError in the base class.

Parameters:
  • value: The value to convert.
validate_wrap(value)¶

Called before wrapping. Calls is_valid_wrap() and raises a BadValueException if validation fails

Parameters:
  • value: The value to validate
validate_unwrap(value)¶

Called before unwrapping. Calls is_valid_unwrap() and raises a BadValueException if validation fails

Note

is_valid_unwrap calls is_valid_wrap, so any class without a is_valid_unwrap function is inheriting that behaviour.

Parameters:
  • value: The value to check
is_valid_wrap(value)¶

Returns whether value is a valid value to wrap. Raises NotImplementedError in the base class.

Parameters:
  • value: The value to check
is_valid_unwrap(value)¶

Returns whether value is a valid value to unwrap. Raises NotImplementedError in the base class.

Parameters:
  • value: The value to check

Primitive Fields¶

class mongoalchemy.fields.PrimitiveField(constructor, **kwargs)¶

Primitive fields are fields where a single constructor can be used for wrapping and unwrapping an object.

wrap(value)¶
unwrap(value)¶
class mongoalchemy.fields.StringField(max_length=None, min_length=None, **kwargs)¶

Unicode Strings. unicode is used to wrap and unwrap values, and any subclass of basestring is an acceptable input

Parameters:
  • max_length: maximum string length
  • min_length: minimum string length
  • **kwargs: arguments for Field
validate_wrap(value)¶

Validates the type and length of value

class mongoalchemy.fields.BoolField(**kwargs)¶

True or False.

validate_wrap(value)¶
class mongoalchemy.fields.NumberField(constructor, min_value=None, max_value=None, **kwargs)¶

Base class for numeric fields

Parameters:
  • max_value: maximum value
  • min_value: minimum value
  • **kwargs: arguments for Field
validate_wrap(value, type)¶

Validates the type and value of value

class mongoalchemy.fields.IntField(**kwargs)¶

Subclass of NumberField for int

Parameters:
  • max_length: maximum value
  • min_length: minimum value
  • **kwargs: arguments for Field
validate_wrap(value)¶

Validates the type and value of value

class mongoalchemy.fields.FloatField(**kwargs)¶

Subclass of NumberField for float

Parameters:
  • max_value: maximum value
  • min_value: minimum value
  • **kwargs: arguments for Field
validate_wrap(value)¶

Validates the type and value of value

class mongoalchemy.fields.DateTimeField(min_date=None, max_date=None, **kwargs)¶

Field for datetime objects.

Parameters:
  • max_date: maximum date
  • min_date: minimum date
  • **kwargs: arguments for Field
validate_wrap(value)¶

Validates the value’s type as well as it being in the valid date range

class mongoalchemy.fields.TupleField(*item_types, **kwargs)¶

Represents a field which is a tuple of a fixed size with specific types for each element in the field.

Examples TupleField(IntField(), BoolField()) would accept [19, False] as a value for both wrapping and unwrapping.

Parameters:
  • *item_types: instances of Field, in the order they will appear in the tuples.
  • **kwargs: arguments for Field
validate_wrap(value)¶

Checks that the correct number of elements are in value and that each element validates agains the associated Field class

validate_unwrap(value)¶

Checks that the correct number of elements are in value and that each element validates agains the associated Field class

wrap(value)¶

Validate and then wrap value for insertion. Parameters

  • value: the tuple (or list) to wrap
unwrap(value)¶

Validate and then unwrap value for object creation. Parameters

  • value: list returned from the database.
class mongoalchemy.fields.EnumField(item_type, *values, **kwargs)¶

Represents a single value out of a list of possible values, all of the same type. == is used for comparison

Example: EnumField(IntField(), 4, 6, 7) would accept anything in (4, 6, 7) as a value. It would not accept 5.

Parameters:
  • item_type: Instance of Field to use for validation, and (un)wrapping
  • values: Possible values. item_type.is_valid_wrap(value) should be True
validate_wrap(value)¶

Checks that value is valid for EnumField.item_type and that value is one of the values specified when the EnumField was constructed

validate_unwrap(value)¶

Checks that value is valid for EnumField.item_type.

Note

Since checking the value itself is not possible until is is actually unwrapped, that check is done in EnumField.unwrap()

wrap(value)¶

Validate and wrap value using the wrapping function from EnumField.item_type

unwrap(value)¶

Unwrap value using the unwrap function from EnumField.item_type. Since unwrap validation could not happen in is_valid_wrap, it happens in this function.

class mongoalchemy.fields.ObjectIdField(**kwargs)¶

pymongo Object ID object. Currently this is probably too strict. A string version of an ObjectId should also be acceptable

validate_wrap(value)¶

Checks that value is a pymongo ObjectId

wrap(value)¶

Validates that value is an ObjectId, then returns it

unwrap(value)¶

Validates that value is an ObjectId, then returns it

class mongoalchemy.fields.AnythingField(required=True, default=UNSET, db_field=None)¶

A field that passes through whatever is set with no validation. Useful for free-form objects

wrap(value)¶

Always returns the value passed in

unwrap(value)¶

Always returns the value passed in

validate_unwrap(value)¶

Always passes

validate_wrap(value)¶

Always passes

Sequence Type Fields¶

class mongoalchemy.fields.SequenceField(item_type, min_capacity=None, max_capacity=None, **kwargs)¶

Base class for Fields which are an iterable collection of objects in which every child element is of the same type

Parameters:
  • item_type: Field instance used for validation and (un)wrapping
  • min_capacity: minimum number of items contained in values
  • max_capacity: maximum number of items contained in values
child_type()¶

Returns the Field instance used for items in the sequence

validate_wrap(value)¶

Checks that the type of value is correct as well as validating the elements of value

validate_unwrap(value)¶

Checks that the type of value is correct as well as validating the elements of value

class mongoalchemy.fields.ListField(item_type, min_capacity=None, max_capacity=None, **kwargs)¶

Field representing a python list.

See also

SequenceField

Parameters:
  • item_type: Field instance used for validation and (un)wrapping
  • min_capacity: minimum number of items contained in values
  • max_capacity: maximum number of items contained in values
wrap(value)¶

Wraps the elements of value using ListField.item_type and returns them in a list

unwrap(value)¶

Unwraps the elements of value using ListField.item_type and returns them in a list

class mongoalchemy.fields.SetField(item_type, min_capacity=None, max_capacity=None, **kwargs)¶

Field representing a python set.

See also

SequenceField

Parameters:
  • item_type: Field instance used for validation and (un)wrapping
  • min_capacity: minimum number of items contained in values
  • max_capacity: maximum number of items contained in values
wrap(value)¶

Unwraps the elements of value using SetField.item_type and returns them in a set

unwrap(value)¶

Unwraps the elements of value using SetField.item_type and returns them in a set

Mapping Type Fields¶

class mongoalchemy.fields.DictField(value_type, **kwargs)¶

Stores String to value_type Dictionaries. For non-string keys use KVField. Strings also must obey the mongo key rules (no . or $)

Parameters:
  • value_type: the Field type to use for the values
validate_unwrap(value)¶

Checks that value is a dict, that every key is a valid MongoDB key, and that every value validates based on DictField.value_type

validate_wrap(value)¶

Checks that value is a dict, that every key is a valid MongoDB key, and that every value validates based on DictField.value_type

wrap(value)¶

Validates value and then returns a dictionary with each key in value mapped to its value wrapped with DictField.value_type

unwrap(value)¶

Validates value and then returns a dictionary with each key in value mapped to its value unwrapped using DictField.value_type

class mongoalchemy.fields.KVField(key_type, value_type, **kwargs)¶

Like a DictField, except it allows arbitrary keys. The DB Format for a KVField is [ { 'k' : key, 'v' : value }, ...]. This will eventually makes it possible to have an index on the keys and values.

Parameters:
  • key_type: the Field type to use for the keys
  • value_type: the Field type to use for the values
validate_unwrap(value)¶

Expects a list of dictionaries with k and v set to the keys and values that will be unwrapped into the output python dictionary should have

wrap(value)¶

Expects a dictionary with the keys being instances of KVField.key_type and the values being instances of KVField.value_type. After validation, the dictionary is transformed into a list of dictionaries with k and v fields set to the keys and values from the original dictionary.

unwrap(value)¶

Expects a list of dictionaries with k and v set to the keys and values that will be unwrapped into the output python dictionary should have. Validates the input and then constructs the dictionary from the list.

Document Field Objects¶

class mongoalchemy.document.DocumentField(document_class, **kwargs)¶

A field which wraps a Document

is_valid_unwrap(value, fields=None)¶

Called before wrapping. Calls is_valid_unwrap() and raises a BadValueException if validation fails

Parameters:
  • value: The value to validate
  • fields: The fields being returned if this is a partial document. They will be ignored when validating the fields of value
wrap(value)¶

Validate value and then use the document’s class to wrap the value

unwrap(value, fields=None)¶

Validate value and then use the document’s class to unwrap the value

validate_wrap(value)¶

Checks that value is an instance of DocumentField.document_class. if it is, then validation on its fields has already been done and no further validation is needed.

validate_unwrap(value, fields=None)¶

Validates every field in the underlying document type. If fields is not None, only the fields in fields will be checked.

Computed Field Objects¶

class mongoalchemy.fields.ComputedField(computed_type, deps=None, **kwargs)¶

A computed field is generated based on an object’s other values.

the unwrap function takes a dictionary of K/V pairs of the dependencies. Since dependencies are declared in the class definition all of the dependencies for a computed field should be in the class definition before the computed field itself.

Warning

The computed field interacts weirdly with documents right now, especially with respect to partial loading. If using this class watch out for strange behaviour

Parameters:
  • fun: the function to compute the value of the computed field
  • computed_type: the type to use when wrapping the computed field
  • deps: the names of fields on the current object which should be passed in to compute the value
validate_wrap(value)¶

Check that value is valid for unwrapping with ComputedField.computed_type

validate_unwrap(value)¶

Check that value is valid for unwrapping with ComputedField.computed_type

wrap(value)¶

Validates value and wraps it with ComputedField.computed_type

unwrap(value)¶

Validates value and unwraps it with ComputedField.computed_type

class mongoalchemy.fields.ComputedFieldValue(field, fun)¶
compute_value(doc)¶

Exceptions¶

class mongoalchemy.fields.BadValueException(name, value, reason, cause=None)¶

An exception which is raised when there is something wrong with a value

class mongoalchemy.fields.BadFieldSpecification¶

An exception that is raised when there is an error in creating a field
